DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study is to assess the effect of preoperatively administered intra venous magnesium sulfate in attenuating pressure response to laryngoscopy and endotracheal intubation in adult patients scheduled for elective non ocular surgery
DOC.brief_title: The Effect of Intravenous Magnesium Sulfate on Intraocular Pressure Following Tracheal Intubation
DOC.criteria: 18 to 38 years old ASA I scheduled for elective ENT ambulatory surgeries under general anesthesia specific major hepatic, renal and cardiovascular disease known to have allergic reaction to magnesium sulphate or other drugs , hypermagnesemia hypocalcemia anuria heart block pregnancy any degree of renal insufficiency digitalised patients positive history of glaucoma or intra ocular hypertension refused to participate
